title: How to Shift with Paddle Shifters

steps.title: Press the brakes and start your vehicle.
steps.content: Press the brakes and start your vehicle. Turn the key to spark the ignition. If the vehicle you own has no ignition key, press the "START/STOP" button to ignite your engine. Vehicles with paddle shifters have automatic transmissions. This means that there are only two pedals (brake and gas pedal) within the vehicle. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Shift into manual (M) or sport (S) mode to turn the paddles on.
steps.content: Shift into manual (M) or sport (S) mode to turn the paddles on. Keep the brake pedal depressed, and use the shifter on your right. Both manual and sport modes enable the user input of paddle shifters to change gear. Some vehicles may have both manual mode and sport mode available. Regardless, both modes will still support paddle shifter input. [2] X Research source What is sequential mode? Sequential mode is a rare option on some sports and racing cars. It’s functionally identical to sport mode, except it turns your transmission into an F1-style gearbox where the car cannot shift up or down by more than one gear at a time.

steps.title: Accelerate using the gas pedal.
steps.content: Accelerate using the gas pedal. Pay attention to the tachometer (located to the left of your speedometer). You'll notice that as you accelerate, the tachometer value increases. This value will help you determine when to shift up and down while driving. [3] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Pick your shift point.
steps.content: Pick your shift point. For normal driving, you'll want to shift between 2700 rpm and 3300 rpm. Every car is different so it's best you use the tachometer to find your shift point rather than your speedometer. [4] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Press the upshift paddle on the right side of the steering column to shift up.
steps.content: Press the upshift paddle on the right side of the steering column to shift up. Do this while accelerating. The upshift paddle is usually the paddle on the right and, in most cars, has a + on it. You'll notice an audible change in the engine speed as well as the sensation of changing gear. [5] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source If you try to upshift while you’re cruising or braking, you’ll likely end up slipping your transmission and feel the car struggle to swap back into the correct gear.

steps.title: Repeat the process until you've reached your desired speed.
steps.content: Repeat the process until you've reached your desired speed. If you want to maintain that speed for a great distance, be sure to keep shifting up gears until your tachometer value is between 1500 rpm and 2000 rpm. Keeping your value within this range will ensure that you maintain good fuel efficiency while at your desired cruising speed. [6] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Change your shift point depending on your driving style.
steps.content: Change your shift point depending on your driving style. For normal, relaxed driving, a shift point between 2700 rpm and 3300 rpm is ideal. For spirited performance driving, you'll want to pick a shift point closer to your redline limiter. On the tachometer, this is indicated usually by red tick marks and red lettering. [7] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Decelerate the vehicle using the brake pedal.
steps.content: Decelerate the vehicle using the brake pedal. Pay attention to the tachometer; you'll notice that as you slow down, the tachometer value decreases. This will help you choose your downshift point. [8] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Pick your downshift point.
steps.content: Pick your downshift point. If you are coming to a stop, then you'll want to downshift between 1800 rpm and 2200 rpm. This will ensure that if you need to accelerate again before stopping you will be in the proper power band to do so without lugging the engine or damaging the transmission. [9] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Press the downshift paddle on the left of the steering column to shift down.
steps.content: Press the downshift paddle on the left of the steering column to shift down. Do this while you’re coasting or braking. The downshift paddle is usually the paddle on the left, and in most cars, the paddle will have a - on it. You will notice an audible change in the engine speed as well as the sensation of changing gear. [10] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source You’re probably going to slip the transmission if you downshift while accelerating. It won’t destroy the car or anything, but it will certainly impact the smoothness of your ride.

steps.title: Repeat until you've stopped or reached your desired speed.
steps.content: Repeat until you've stopped or reached your desired speed. Be sure to practice the starting and stopping sequences to better understand your shift points. [11] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Press the brake pedal to shift the vehicle into park.
steps.content: Press the brake pedal to shift the vehicle into park. Use the gear lever, not the paddle shifters, to shift the vehicle into park. Shifting into other gears such as drive, neutral, and reverse follow the same process and the vehicle will automatically disable the paddle shifters once the gear is changed. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Shut the car off.
steps.content: Shut the car off. Once the vehicle is in the park, either turn the key in the ignition counterclockwise or press the ignition stop/start button to turn the vehicle off.

steps.title: Use the clutch pedal on the back at the bottom to shift manually.
steps.content: Use the clutch pedal on the back at the bottom to shift manually. F1-style vehicles do not have clutch pedals—the clutch is located on the back of the steering wheel. In fact, there are two clutches! Use whichever clutch is on the opposite side of the shift button or shift pedal to change gears manually. To do this, simply press the clutch pedal on either side to activate it. [13] X Research source F1 gearboxes are semi-automatic, so you can completely ignore the clutch if you don’t want to change gears manually. Do you have two sets of pedals? If you have paddle shifters and paddle clutches, the clutches are on the bottom.

steps.title: Press the buttons on the front of the steering wheel to shift.
steps.content: Press the buttons on the front of the steering wheel to shift. If you have an F1-style steering wheel to match the F1-style gearbox, your shifters are usually not paddles. They’re buttons, located on the front of the wheel. Look for the (usually color-coded) buttons marked where your thumbs would naturally sit on the wheel. [14] X Research source Like traditional paddle shifters, the button on the left shifts down, and the button on the right shifts up. Do you not have shift buttons? Some (especially older) F1 wheels have the traditional paddles on the back of the wheel. If your wheel has pedal shifters, the left is down, and the right is up. What makes the F1-style gearbox/shifter unique? F1-style gearboxes are sequential, which means you can’t shift over/past a gear. You must move either up or down one gear at a time. Also, these gearboxes are semi-automatic, which means they shift automatically via the on-board computer unless another input is provided. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Press both of the two clutch paddles to shift into neutral.
steps.content: Press both of the two clutch paddles to shift into neutral. The only time you can skip gears in a sequential gearbox is when you go into neutral. To do this, press both clutch pedals to slip all the way back into neutral. [16] X Research source On professional/higher-end F1 wheels, there’s a dedicated “neutral” button or lever directly on the steering wheel. Use that instead if you have access to it. [17] X Research source
